intro: Eriastrum pluriflorum var. sherman-hoytiae, commonly known as the Sherman-Hoyt's eriastrum, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a low-growing annual herb with hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The species belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This plant is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils in its native habitat.
